title: Water in tub: Modeling Riemann sums part - d

content.question: For20≤t≤25 , the function W that models the water temperature has first derivative given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>w</mi> <mo>'</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.4</mn> <msqrt> <mi>t</mi> </msqrt> <mi>cos</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>0.06t</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@454D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> . Based on the model, what is the temperature of the water at time t=25?

frqParts.text: For20≤t≤25 , the function W that models the water temperature has first derivative given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>w</mi> <mo>'</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.4</mn> <msqrt> <mi>t</mi> </msqrt> <mi>cos</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>0.06t</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@454D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> .
